ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Song of Twilight stackability
ygData.msgSnippet: Mez s stack by length of mez, not level.  A longer duration mez will not overrite a shorter duration mez.  So, SoT will always overrite an enchanter mez and
ygData.messageBody:
Mez's stack by length of mez, not level. A longer duration mez will not
overrite a shorter duration mez. So, SoT will always overrite an enchanter
mez and block the enchanter from remezing. The level of the bard/enchanter
has no effect.

On the brighter side I spoke to GZ at the Fan Faire this weekend and they
thinking about allowing chanters to overrite bard mez.

Rokenn

-----Original Message-----
From: Matt DeBarger [mailto:mattdeba@...]
Sent: Monday, April 09, 2001 7:14 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Song of Twilight stackability


I was trying to experiment with Song of Twilight stacking with enchanter
mez. Does anyone know how they work together. Our thoughts (I was with my
new guild's big enchanter killing imps and discussing this. She had to log
before we got to test it) were if I could lay down a SoT or 2 until the
chanters got the mobs locked down, it would be a huge boon for raids.

Does SoT block any/all enchanter mez?
Does it overwrite?

I will try to test this on my own, but how often do you have a lvl 60
enchanter at your disposal?

Elfson Allego <The CIrcle of Eternity>
53 Veeshan
^^^ Hoping to get to 54 before Bard BOTB so he layeth the smack down on
Sartori
